content:
Diagnosis
	1. Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 1, FH deficient
		Initial diagnosis January 2023
		pT3aN0M1 at presentation
		Lower pole right kidney primary with pleural and pulmonary metastases

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment
	Surgery
	15 Jan 2023 Right radical nephrectomy
	Complications: Post-operative ileus requiring prolonged admission

	Systemic therapy
	1. Cabozantinib 60mg OD commenced March 2023
	2. Dose reduction to 40mg OD April 2023 due to grade 3 palmar-plantar syndrome
	3. Current dose 40mg OD with stable disease

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible for current trials due to FH mutation status

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging
	Latest CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis 15 May 2024 shows:
	- Stable pleural deposits largest 2.2cm (previously 2.3cm)
	- Stable pulmonary nodules, largest 8mm right lower lobe
	- No new sites of disease

	Current issues
	1. Grade 1 palmar-plantar syndrome
	2. Stable renal function

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today in medical oncology clinic. Tolerating reduced dose Cabozantinib well with improvement in hand-foot syndrome following previous dose reduction. Latest imaging shows continued disease control. Blood pressure well controlled on amlodipine. Renal function stable with creatinine 132 (baseline 128).

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis in 12 weeks
	Routine blood tests including TFTs in 4 weeks

	Medication prescribed
	Continue Cabozantinib 40mg OD

	Follow up
	Medical oncology review in 4 weeks with blood results
	Repeat imaging review in 12 weeks

cancer_timeline.value: Right radical nephrectomy complicated by post-operative ileus
Cabozantinib dose reduced to 40mg daily due to grade 3 palmar-plantar syndrome
CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis shows stable pleural deposits (largest 2.2cm) and pulmonary nodules (largest 8mm)

status_updates.value: Metastatic papillary renal cell carcinoma with stable disease on reduced dose Cabozantinib
Stable disease on imaging with no new sites of disease
Grade 1 palmar-plantar syndrome, improved following previous dose reduction
CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis in 12 weeks, blood tests including TFTs in 4 weeks
Medical oncology review in 4 weeks with blood results
